title: League Alpha Client
body: I have signed up when the client first came out, I am still wondering as to why i haven't been accepted yet? will you invite more players in the future or are you guys done?

replies.body: New invites are sent with each patch, you can still get an invite for the alpha in the future.
Lol what are the chances that any of us are getting in? :P

I don't know all of their selection criteria, but perhaps something about your account has made Riot choose other players over you so far.

This could just be something like your location globally with respect to Riot's servers and connection statistics: they may have enough people from your area. If you've been punished by the reports system, that might also flag your account to be kept from the alpha client, depending on what the punishment was for.

As the alpha continues, they add increasingly large numbers of players since the client is becoming more stable as time goes on. Maybe you've just been unlucky, and you'll get in soon. This last cycle they added draft queues, and in the next one will be including Ranked. At this point riot says they're opening it up to "hundreds of thousands" of testers. Good luck :)
